title: Screening and identification of key biomarkers in diabetic kidney disease and its complications: Evidence from bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: This SNP was found in an intron of TRIOBP and also exhibited a genome-wide significant association with hearing difficulty in the UK Biobank, reporting a p-value of 1.3e-6. Its importance was underscored by its previous identification in the largest GWAS of ARHI.
title: Biological insights from multi-omic analysis of 31 genomic risk loci for adult hearing difficulty

finding: The rs738409 SNP in the PNPLA3 gene encoded an isoleucine to methionine substitution at codon position 148, which was identified as a genetic polymorphism associated with increased hepatic steatosis and advanced non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD). This finding was noted for its global association with advanced stages of NAFLD and other liver diseases including hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC).
title: Human hepatocyte PNPLA3 148M exacerbates rapid non-alcoholic steatohepatitis development in chimeric mice

finding: The genotyping of hepatocytes for the PNPLA3 rs734809 variant was performed, and this SNP was part of the experimental framework aimed to understand its implications in NAFLD through the engraftment of human hepatocytes in chimeric mice models.
title: Human hepatocyte PNPLA3 148M exacerbates rapid non-alcoholic steatohepatitis development in chimeric mice

finding: The SNP rs2267131 was identified as being enriched in the enhancer 22.1008E, which showed the highest EPIC effect size of 0.43 for the transcription of XBP1 in acinar cells. This finding established a direct connection between this genetic variant and the regulation of XBP1, a gene associated with pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC).
title: Predictive Prioritization of Enhancers Associated with Pancreas Disease Risk

finding: The SNP rs5752810 was found to be located in enhancer 22.1015E, which exhibited a lower EPIC effect size of 0.05. This SNP was linked to the transcriptional regulation of XBP1 in acinar cells, reinforcing its relevance in the context of pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma risk.
title: Predictive Prioritization of Enhancers Associated with Pancreas Disease Risk

finding: Similar to rs5752810, the SNP rs5752811 was also mapped to enhancer 22.1015E and was associated with the regulation of XBP1 transcription in acinar cells, highlighting its contribution to the genetic risk factors for pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma.
title: Predictive Prioritization of Enhancers Associated with Pancreas Disease Risk

finding: The G1 risk variant rs73885319 was introduced into human induced pluripotent stem cells (iPSCs) through CRISPR-Cas9 genome editing, creating a line homozygous for this APOL1 G1 variant. This line displayed nephron-like structures when differentiated into kidney organoids, and it was confirmed that the variant was expressed under APOL1's endogenous regulatory elements following treatment with interferon-gamma (IFN-γ).
title: Profiling APOL1 Nephropathy Risk Variants in Genome-Edited Kidney Organoids with Single-Cell Transcriptomics

finding: The G1 risk variant rs60910145 was also introduced into human iPSCs using a genomic footprint-free approach via CRISPR-Cas9. Similar to rs73885319, this variant resulted in the expression of APOL1 when organoids were treated with IFN-γ and affected the gene's regulatory responses in kidney cells, contributing to the pathophysiological understanding of APOL1-mediated kidney disease.
title: Profiling APOL1 Nephropathy Risk Variants in Genome-Edited Kidney Organoids with Single-Cell Transcriptomics

finding: In the context of the CYP2D6 gene, the variant rs746803316 was identified as a novel core variant in the study. It was cataloged as a variant that could affect protein functionality, and notably, it had not been included in the PharmVar database as a core variant prior to this study.
title: The variation landscape of CYP2D6 in a multi-ethnic Asian population

finding: The SNP rs3915951 was found to be a novel core variant associated with the CYP2D6 gene. This variant was reported to carry functional implications and was not previously cataloged in the PharmVar database, marking it as a significant finding in the analysis of CYP2D6 variations.
title: The variation landscape of CYP2D6 in a multi-ethnic Asian population

finding: The study uncovered the SNP rs1135830 as a novel core variant related to the CYP2D6 gene. This variant contained functional variants that may alter protein functionality and had not been listed in the PharmVar database prior to the present research.
title: The variation landscape of CYP2D6 in a multi-ethnic Asian population

finding: The variant rs759234339 was categorized as a novel core variant linked to the CYP2D6 gene in this analysis. It held functional implications for protein functionality and had not been previously recorded in the PharmVar database, highlighting its relevance in the exploration of CYP2D6 genetic variants.
title: The variation landscape of CYP2D6 in a multi-ethnic Asian population

finding: The rs10314 variant in the claudin-5 gene was associated with schizophrenia (SZ) diagnosis in a large cohort of female patients with 22q11.2 deletion syndrome (22qDS), as demonstrated in recent work by the authors' lab. This finding highlighted the potential role of claudin-5 in the pathology of neuropsychiatric disorders, particularly in the context of compromised blood-brain barrier (BBB) integrity related to 22qDS.
title: Disruption of the Blood-Brain Barrier in 22q11.2 Deletion Syndrome

finding: The rs138349, found in the chr22:41049522-41449522 locus, was identified as the lead candidate causal variant colocalizing with eQTLs for ADSL in fetal-like isPSC-PPCs and ST13 in adult pancreatic tissues, implicated in cholesterol and LDL metabolism.
title: eQTL mapping in fetal-like pancreatic progenitor cells reveals early developmental insights into diabetes risk

finding: The variant rs738409, known as PNPLA3-I148M, was identified as the most significant genetic determinant of fatty liver disease across populations. The study demonstrated that the I148M variant impeded the secretion of Apolipoprotein B (ApoB) from liver cells, which is critical for the biogenesis of very low-density lipoproteins (VLDLs). This mechanism was further supported by related findings in mice models expressing the human I148M variant, which exhibited similar VLDL secretion defects. Additionally, the context of the finding relates to nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) prevalence and suggests that PNPLA3-I148M influences triglyceride clearance through blockade of two key pathways dependent on CGI-58.
title: PNPLA3-I148M is a Neomorph that Interferes with Two Primary Hepatic Triglyceride Clearance Pathways

finding: SNP rs4911713 was found to be associated with the LOC102723769-OR11H1-POTEH locus, significantly linked to the salivary species F0422 uSGB 392, which belongs to the family Veillonellaceae, indicated by its strong association with the microbial ecosystems in the oral cavity.
title: Metagenome-genome-wide association studies reveal human genetic impact on the oral microbiome

finding: The SNP rs5758837, located in the promoter region of the CYB5R3 gene, was associated with various phenotypes linked to Type 2 Diabetes. This finding was derived from a PheWAS analysis, indicating that variations in the CYB5R3 promoter might play a role in diabetes pathophysiology, particularly relating to the mechanisms of pancreatic beta-cell function and response to metabolic stress as detailed in the study.
title: Cyb5r3 links FoxO1-dependent mitochondrial dysfunction with β-cell failure

finding: The SNP rs6010226 was related to mutations in isocitrate dehydrogenase 1 (mIDH1) which were the most common mutations identified in gliomas and were associated with an improved prognosis. These mutations, particularly in the context of ATRX and TP53 inactivation, were linked to elevated levels of G-CSF in gliomas, facilitating the recruitment and expansion of granulocytic myeloid cells, including non-immunosuppressive neutrophils and pre-neutrophils, contributing to an immune permissive tumor microenvironment.
title: G-CSF Secreted by Epigenetically Reprogrammed Mutant IDH1 Glioma Stem Cells Reverses the Myeloid Cells’-Mediated Immunosuppressive Tumor Microenvironment

finding: The SNP rs6010376 was associated with the activation of STAT3 in glioblastoma. This relationship highlighted the significant role of STAT3 in glioblastoma development and progression, which could influence therapeutic strategies targeting this pathway.
title: RIT1: A Novel Biomarker in Glioblastoma

finding: The deepSNP rs137969 on chromosome 22 was identified as influencing regulatory mechanisms for MS, alongside rs12768537 and rs62420820.
title: DeepWAS: Multivariate genotype-phenotype associations by directly integrating regulatory information using deep learning

finding: The rs738409 C>G variant in PNPLA3 was identified as a key factor in the development of metabolic dysfunction-associated steatotic liver disease (MASLD). Patients carrying the GG genotype exhibited significantly impaired mitochondrial respiration and structure, contributing to mitochondrial dysfunction as noted through decreased oxygen consumption rates (OCR) when compared to non-risk variant carriers.
title: Serum mitochondrial bioenergetics as fingerprint of the hepatic one: how to monitor genetic MASLD

finding: This SNP showed an association with monocyte counts, contributing to the understanding of monocyte biology in relation to ACKR2.
title: Eosinophils promote monocyte to macrophage differentiation and anti-bacterial immunity

finding: The SNP rs738409, situated on chromosome 22, was also highlighted in the GWAS focused on liver fat, showing a highly significant p-value of 4.6×10^-166. It was mapped to genes associated with metabolic associated liver disease (MAFLD) and was closely tied to the genetic architecture of liver fat.
title: The role of liver fat in cardiometabolic diseases is highlighted by genome-wide association study of MRI-derived measures of body composition

finding: The study identified the PNPLA3 rs738409 variant, specifically the I148M mutation, as a significant genomic modifier related to the development and progression of metabolic dysfunction-associated steatotic liver disease (MASLD). The findings indicated that the PNPLA3-I148M iPSC-derived hepatocyte-like cells exhibited a heightened susceptibility to mitochondrial injury from adipokines and myokines, in contrast to the non-mutant PNPLA3-WT line. This suggests that the SNP is a crucial factor in understanding the underlying mechanisms of cellular injury in MASLD.
title: Dissecting compounded hepatocyte injury in a model of MASLD progression from human induced pluripotent stem cells

finding: The SNP rs5759167, located within the PACSIN2 promoter region, was linked to prostate and lung cancers and was also significant as an eQTL for PACSIN2.
title: Pan-Cancer Study Detects Novel Genetic Risk Variants and Shared Genetic Basis in Two Large Cohorts

finding: The SNP rs738409 was identified as a missense lead variant in the PNPLA3 gene, which is a well-established locus for non-alcoholic fatty liver disease. This variant colocalized with a GWAS signal for type 2 diabetes. Furthermore, it was linked to a trans-pQTL for ADP Ribosylation Factor Interacting Protein 2 (ARFIP2), which was found to be strongly downregulated in type 2 diabetes patients in the AGES cohort. This provided insights into potential interactions between PNPLA3 and ARFIP2 regarding their roles in type 2 diabetes.
title: A genome-wide association study of serum proteins reveals shared loci with common diseases

finding: The study reported that the SNP rs16947 (2851C>T) was variant in two haplotypes (CYP2D6*13 and CYP2D6*2) while the haplotype on the other chromosome was reference (CYP2D6*1). The value for the allelic ratio associated with rs16947 was 2.04, indicating the presence of variant alleles.
title: Haplotype phasing of CYP2D6: an allelic ratio method using Agena MassARRAY data

finding: For rs1135840 (4181G>C), the findings indicated that this SNP was variant in all haplotypes under study (CYP2D6*13, CYP2D6*2, CYP2D6*4, CYP2D6*36, and CYP2D6*10). The ratios for samples carrying different haplotypes showed values of 1.65, 16.56, 15.95, and a mean calculated ratio of 1.72, collectively demonstrating variance in gene activity.
title: Haplotype phasing of CYP2D6: an allelic ratio method using Agena MassARRAY data

finding: The SNP rs3892097 was a definitive marker for the CYP2D6*4 haplotype. It presented an allelic ratio of infinity, consistent with the prior genotype consensus, confirming its role as a strong indicator of this haplotype's presence.
title: Haplotype phasing of CYP2D6: an allelic ratio method using Agena MassARRAY data

finding: The findings reported for rs1065852 indicated lower than expected allelic ratios across the three haplotypes tested, showing ratios of 1.22 and a mean calculated ratio of 1.29, highlighting that while CYP2D6*10 and CYP2D6*36 had the variant allele, they resulted in ratios lower than the anticipated value.
title: Haplotype phasing of CYP2D6: an allelic ratio method using Agena MassARRAY data

finding: The study involved human hepatocytes that were genotyped as C/G at rs738409, indicating that they were heterozygous for the PNPLA3 NASH-risk variant. This specific genetic variant is known to exacerbate nonalcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH) in hu-liver mice. The successful application of GalNAc-siTAZ in mice with rs738409-C/G hepatocytes provided additional evidence supporting the potential effectiveness of this therapy in addressing NASH progression, demonstrating that the intervention could yield positive results even in the presence of this genetic risk factor.
title: Hepatocyte-Targeted siTAZ Therapy Lowers Liver Fibrosis in NASH Diet-Fed Chimeric Mice with Hepatocyte-Humanized Livers

finding: The SNP rs36062310, a Val504Met missense variant in the KLHDC7B gene, demonstrated a strong association with self-reported hearing in the UK Biobank GWAS, yielding a p-value of 1.90E-22. Furthermore, a meta-analysis of five cohorts evidenced the same variant's association with adult hearing loss with a p-value of 4.24E-26. Additionally, rare variant analysis indicated heterozygous predicted loss-of-function variants in KLHDC7B that were correlated with increased risk of hearing loss, resulting in an odds ratio of 2.145. These findings collectively underlined KLHDC7B as a novel candidate gene for age-related hearing loss (ARHL).
title: KLHDC7B, a novel gene associated with age-related hearing loss in humans, is required for the maintenance of hearing in mice

finding: The SNP rs6519353 was shown to notably affect EGR1 binding by altering 7 overlapping binding sites. This result highlighted the role of overlapping DNA binding sites on gene regulation and indicated implications for gene expression influenced by noncoding variants.
title: Overlapping binding sites underlie TF genomic occupancy

finding: The SNP rs2142833 was associated with Haplogroup A, showing a high linkage (r2=0.93) in the global population. It demonstrated that this haplogroup has been maintained at similar frequencies in Europe and East Asia over the past 40,000 years.
title: Distinct haplogroups with star-like diversification in the APOBEC3 regulatory region indicate ancient viral pandemics before and during the Out-of-Africa migration of modern humans

finding: The SNP rs9607601 was linked to Haplogroup B with a perfect linkage (r2=1) in the global population. This SNP also showed similar haplogroup frequency stability in Europe and East Asia throughout the last 40,000 years.
title: Distinct haplogroups with star-like diversification in the APOBEC3 regulatory region indicate ancient viral pandemics before and during the Out-of-Africa migration of modern humans

finding: The SNP rs11089916 was associated with Haplogroup C, exhibiting a perfect linkage (r2=1) particularly noted in CEU and JPT populations. It contributed to the understanding of haplogroup frequency maintenance in historical demographics.
title: Distinct haplogroups with star-like diversification in the APOBEC3 regulatory region indicate ancient viral pandemics before and during the Out-of-Africa migration of modern humans

finding: The SNP rs5995653, linked to Haplogroup B, was associated with asthma exacerbations in admixed children treated with inhaled corticosteroids (p=5.0E-6; OR=1.52), and the same association was also identified in European populations (p=7.52E-3), suggesting the influence of Haplogroup B on immune responses.
title: Distinct haplogroups with star-like diversification in the APOBEC3 regulatory region indicate ancient viral pandemics before and during the Out-of-Africa migration of modern humans

finding: SNP rs6001366, the index SNP for sub-Haplogroup B2, was also found to be associated with asthma exacerbations (p=3.0E-6, OR=2.13), further indicating a significant impact of Haplogroup B on immune-related phenotypes.
title: Distinct haplogroups with star-like diversification in the APOBEC3 regulatory region indicate ancient viral pandemics before and during the Out-of-Africa migration of modern humans

finding: The non-synonymous single nucleotide variant (SNV) rs16947 located within exon 6 of the CYP2D6 gene was strongly associated with a higher abundance of CYP2D6 exon 3 skipping junctions. This association resulted in an in-frame deletion, shortening the translated protein by 51 amino acids, which could lead to reduced enzyme activity in drug metabolism.
title: Variations and expression features of CYP2D6 contribute to schizophrenia risk

finding: The SNP rs133377 was found in high linkage disequilibrium with rs16947 and was significantly associated with multiple active transcription start sites in the CYP2D6 region. It also showed strong associations with the abundance of CYP2D6 exon junctions, indicating its integral role in regulating gene transcription linked to schizophrenia.
title: Variations and expression features of CYP2D6 contribute to schizophrenia risk

finding: The intronic variant rs13054904 in RSPH14, while its function is unclear, was associated with the genetic architecture of nephrolithiasis, indicating a broader role in calcium regulation.
title: Genetic variants of calcium and vitamin D metabolism in kidney stone disease

finding: The SNP rs147122512 is an intronic variant of SGSM3, which was found to be up-regulated in myocardial infarction models, a condition associated with cardiovascular disease and cholesterol levels.
title: Genetically regulated gene expression underlies lipid traits in Hispanic cohorts

finding: The SNP rs73885319 in APOL was noted for its role in adaptations related to immune function and was evidenced by its placement in the top 5% of the MU distribution.
title: Network-based analysis of allele frequency distribution among multiple populations identifies adaptive genomic structural variants

finding: The genetic variation in the ADORA2A gene (rs5751876) was associated with variations in oscillatory alpha power during both wakefulness and sleep. Specifically, homozygous C-allele carriers exhibited higher alpha power compared to both heterozygous and homozygous T-allele carriers. Moreover, the ADORA2A genotype was shown to significantly affect A1 adenosine receptor binding potential, particularly in the occipital region of the brain. Females showed a correlation between individual differences in alpha power and adenosine receptor availability, indicating a direct modulatory effect through the A1 adenosine receptors affecting EEG measurements.
title: A genetic variation in the adenosine A2A receptor gene contributes to variability in oscillatory alpha power in wake and sleep EEG and A1 adenosine receptor availability in the human brain

finding: This SNP was confirmed to regulate ARVCF expression, with a significant decrease in gene levels observed in CRISPRi experiments.
title: Comprehensive identification of coronary artery disease-associated variants regulating vascular smooth muscle cell gene expression

finding: The rs738409 GG genotype in the NAFLD group was identified as a risk factor for developing complications in Japanese patients with liver cirrhosis (LC). It was reported that this genotype significantly increased the odds of complications compared to the CC genotype, with an odds ratio of 2.415 when considering the interaction with rs58542926. This polymorphism is associated with advanced liver steatosis and hepatic-related inflammatory conditions.
title: The impact of PNPLA3 and TM6SF2 in cirrhosis related complications

finding: The Val158Met polymorphism (rs4680) in the COMT gene was associated with temporal impulsivity, indicating that individuals with the Val/Val genotype had decreased prefrontal dopamine levels and a greater preference for immediate rewards. This finding suggested that lower dopaminergic transmission in the prefrontal cortex might correlate with increased delay discounting, particularly in relation to gender and age.
title: DRD2/ANKK1 Taq1A but not COMT single nucleotide polymorphisms contribute to the link between temporal impulsivity and obesity in men

finding: The rs755622 SNP in the MIF promoter was associated with increased leukocyte infiltration in glioblastoma (GBM). Furthermore, patients with this SNP exhibited heightened lactotransferrin (LTF) expression, suggesting a potential correlation with immune activation in the tumor microenvironment.
title: The MIF SNP rs755622 is a germline determinant of tumor immune activation in Glioblastoma

finding: The rs2096525 SNP, in linkage disequilibrium with rs755622, was found to correlatively increase immune activation in GBM patients who carried the minor allele, demonstrating trends similar to those observed with rs755622.
title: The MIF SNP rs755622 is a germline determinant of tumor immune activation in Glioblastoma

finding: The SNP rs6006399, located in the HORMAD2 gene at 22q12.1, showed a significant association with forced expiratory volume in one second (FEV1) with a p-value of 1.9×10^-18. This finding was considered an original discovery related to lung function.
title: Immune-mediated genetic pathways resulting in pulmonary function impairment increase lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The analysis focused on SNP rs131811, which was introduced into the 293T human cell line through CRISPR editing with an HDR template. The sequencing of the editing experiment resulted in 70,649 reads, of which 69,625 were well-aligned and used for further analysis. This demonstrated the successful introduction of the SNP into the cell line, showcasing the potential of EdiTyper for accurate detection of single nucleotide mutations in genomic data.
title: EdiTyper: a high-throughput tool for analysis of targeted sequencing data from genome editing experiments

finding: This SNP led to the I157T missense mutation in CHEK2, which was linked to increased risk for cancers including MPNs and implicates genotoxic response pathways.
title: Genetic predisposition to myeloproliferative neoplasms implicates hematopoietic stem cell biology

finding: The rs136403 variant was identified as a pleiotropic variant for pack-years of smoking affecting both WC and HC (hip circumference). This highlights its significant role in how cumulative smoking impacts fat distribution.
title: Estimating the causal relationship between smoking and abdominal adiposity using Mendelian randomization

finding: In the SCAMPI results, rs738409 in PNPLA3 was associated with the correlation of triglycerides and BMI, and the variance of triglycerides as corroborated by the PheWAS, which also linked it to BMI.
title: SCAMPI: A scalable statistical framework for genome-wide interaction testing harnessing cross-trait correlations

finding: This SNP was found to cause significant changes in splice site usage and predicted splicing effects consistent with measured q-RT-PCR results.
title: Expression changes confirm predicted single nucleotide variants affecting mRNA splicing

finding: The SNP affected the acceptor site resulting in substantial changes to splice forms that were confirmed through targeted expression analysis.
title: Expression changes confirm predicted single nucleotide variants affecting mRNA splicing

finding: The SNP rs3892097 was identified as one of the two variants that compose the CYP2D6 *4 haplotype and was seen as heterozygous in the Denisovan individual. This haplotype was shown to confer an intermediate metabolizer status in modern humans, suggesting that it may influence the metabolism of various drugs in these populations.
title: Pharmacogenetic variation in Neanderthals and Denisovans and implications for human health and response to medications

finding: Similar to rs3892097, the SNP rs1065852 was also part of the CYP2D6 *4 haplotype and identified in the Denisovan individual as heterozygous. Its presence alongside rs3892097 reinforced the potential for intermediate metabolizer status in modern humans carrying these variants.
title: Pharmacogenetic variation in Neanderthals and Denisovans and implications for human health and response to medications

finding: The PNPLA3 rs738409 polymorphism was associated with liver fibrosis risk in NASH patients, particularly with influencing liver function.
title: The Identification of Key Genes and Biological Pathways in Polycystic Ovary Syndrome and its Complications by Next Generation Squancing (NGS) and Bioinformatics Analysis

finding: The SNP rs713782 was implicated in association with coronary heart disease (CHD) and was previously reported as associated with CHD risk. HyPrColoc extended this finding by identifying that this variant shares colocalization with five conventional CHD risk factors, explaining over 76% of the posterior probability of colocalization.
title: A fast and efficient colocalization algorithm for identifying shared genetic risk factors across multiple traits

finding: The SNP rs134873 was associated with significant allelic differences in K562 and SH-SY5Y cells and functioned as an eQTL for one or more genes in the DLPFC, highlighting its regulatory role.
title: A screen of 1,049 schizophrenia and 30 Alzheimer’s-associated variants for regulatory potential

finding: The study reported findings related to significant interannual variations in phytoplankton primary production, which is connected to the ecological dynamics influenced by chloroplast functionalities. The localization atlas of chloroplast proteins in the model alga Chlamydomonas reinhardtii may offer insights into how specific genetic variations, such as those represented by SNP rs6010001, could impact primary production mechanisms in various environmental contexts.
title: A Chloroplast Protein Atlas Reveals Novel Structures and Spatial Organization of Biosynthetic Pathways

finding: The frameshift variant rs555607708 situated in CHEK2 was among the coding changes found to be deleterious and connected to breast cancer risk factors.
title: Fine-mapping of 150 breast cancer risk regions identifies 178 high confidence target genes

finding: The missense variant rs17879961 in CHEK2 was included in the recognized set of potentially deleterious coding changes identified in connection with breast cancer risk.
title: Fine-mapping of 150 breast cancer risk regions identifies 178 high confidence target genes

finding: The rs11089781 SNP in APOL3, observed predominantly in African populations, was associated with signals of positive selection linked to defense against African trypanosomes.
title: Common homozygosity for predicted loss-of-function variants reveals both redundant and advantageous effects of dispensable human genes

finding: The variant rs73885319 in the gene APOL1 was associated with end-stage kidney disease (ESKD) and showed a higher frequency in African/African-American populations. In gnomAD, its allele frequency was reported as 0.06 but was significantly higher at 0.22 in the African/African-American group. The allele frequency in the IGSR dataset was 0.07, with a low Allele Dispersion Score (ADS) of 0.14, indicating it was mostly carried by individuals identified as AFR.
title: Allele Dispersion Score: Quantifying the range of allele frequencies across populations, based on UMAP

finding: The study found a significant association between the COMT rs4680 genotype and personality traits as defined in the NEO-PI-R model. Specifically, individuals with the Met allele exhibited higher levels of self-consciousness within the neuroticism domain. Conversely, those carrying the Val allele demonstrated significantly higher scores in the extraversion domain and its facets, including warmth, gregariousness, and positive emotions. Additionally, Val carriers scored better on competence and achievement striving in the conscientiousness domain. Overall, the research indicated that increased dopamine signaling linked to the Met allele was correlated with a sensitivity to negative reinforcement, while the Val allele was associated with heightened reward sensitivity and approach-oriented behavior.
title: Personality and MB-COMT gene: molecular-genetic and epigenetic associations with NEO-PI-R personality domains and facets in monozygotic twins

finding: The SNP rs73185306 was found to be modestly associated with HHV-6A/B integration with a P value of 0.013 and an odds ratio (OR) of 2.38. A subsequent GWAS revealed a much stronger association with HHV-6A (P = 1.85E-05, OR = 7.36) but not with HHV-6B (P = 0.578, OR = 0.54). This suggested that the ancestral integration of HHV-6A could be significantly linked to this SNP.
title: Endogenization and excision of human herpesvirus 6 in human genomes

finding: The SNP rs566665421 was linked to integrated HHV-6A in the analyzed subjects. It was present in six subjects carrying endogenous HHV-6A, confirming its physical linkage to an integrated HHV-6A variant within chr22q.
title: Endogenization and excision of human herpesvirus 6 in human genomes

finding: The SNP rs9611486 was characterized as a radial glial eQTL for EP300, a gene linked to various neurodevelopmental disorders such as autism and Rubinstein-Taybi syndrome 2. This SNP was identified as a risk factor for anxiety symptoms, demonstrating a relevant context-specific expression profile that was uncovered under oxygen-responsive conditions, which emphasizes the significance of studying dynamic cellular environments in genetic research.
title: Oxygen-induced stress reveals context-specific gene regulatory effects in human brain organoids

finding: The SNP rs13057823 was identified as an sQTL that colocalized with the Total Hip Replacement (THR) GWAS signal (index variant rs12160491) for the gene GCAT, which operated consistently under both PBS and FN-f conditions. This finding suggested that GCAT splicing was crucial in both conditions in relation to OA risk.
title: Response splicing QTLs in primary human chondrocytes identifies putative osteoarthritis risk genes

finding: Similar to rs13057823, the SNP rs2071910 was also identified as an sQTL that colocalized with the THR GWAS signal affecting the GCAT gene. Like rs13057823, this sQTL impacted the same splice intron junction, reinforcing its association with OA risk across varying conditions.
title: Response splicing QTLs in primary human chondrocytes identifies putative osteoarthritis risk genes

finding: With a minor allele frequency of 0.4963, rs987640 also represented a significant genetic marker for the population analyzed.
title: The forensic landscape and the population genetic analyses of Hainan Li based on massively parallel sequencing DNA profiling

finding: The non-coding transcript exon variant rs140846043 of MIRLET7BHG was associated with height, a connection that highlighted the importance of analyzing WGS data to uncover such associations.
title: Joint modelling of whole genome sequence data for human height via approximate message passing

finding: The SNP rs73885319, associated with the APOL1 gene, exhibited significant variation in allele frequencies among the South Eastern Bantu-speaking (SEB) groups. Specifically, it revealed a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 0.03 in the Sotho group and 0.18 in the Xhosa group, indicating almost a six-fold difference. This finding was critical in exploring the phenotypic implications of genetic differences between SEB groups.
title: Genetic-substructure and complex demographic history of South African Bantu speakers

finding: The SNP rs133885 was replicated in the study, associated with division ability, with a p-value of 1.053×10−5. This SNP had previously been linked to general mathematical ability and was validated against the results from a different cohort, emphasizing its significance in predictive models for specific mathematical skills.
title: A genome-wide association study identified new variants associated with mathematical abilities in Chinese children

finding: The SNP rs855791 in the TMPRSS6 gene demonstrated a strong association with hemoglobin concentration, showing a p-value of 3.49e-241 and a beta coefficient of 0.0692, indicating its involvement in the genetic architecture of sickle cell anemia.
title: Low generalizability of polygenic scores in African populations due to genetic and environmental diversity

finding: The rs874100 SNP was identified as an eQTL for the MED15 gene, associated with height. The minor C allele disrupted Z-DNA formation and prevented the SCARF2 transcript from folding into Z-RNA, thereby leading to lower MED15 expression levels. This effect was correlated with the increased MED15 gene expression linked to the G allele.
title: Z-Flipon Variants reveal the many roles of Z-DNA and Z-RNA in health and disease

finding: The study investigated the variant rs5751876 of the ADORA2A gene, specifically focusing on its association with caffeine sensitivity and its impact on grey matter (GM) alterations due to sleep restriction. It was found that individuals with the C/C homozygous genotype (29 participants) exhibited distinct responses to caffeine and sleep loss compared to those with other genotypes. The findings suggested that low baseline availability of A1 receptors (A1R), which is associated with the rs5751876 variant, predicted greater reductions in GM size following chronic sleep restriction (CSR) when caffeine was consumed, indicating that individual genetic differences significantly influenced the neuroanatomical plasticity in response to simultaneous caffeine intake and sleep deprivation.
title: Repeated Caffeine Intake Suppresses Cerebral Grey Matter Responses to Chronic Sleep Restriction in an A1 Adenosine Receptor-Dependent Manner

finding: The PNPLA3 rs738409 SNP was linked to elevated transaminase levels in overweight/obese individuals, which may reflect implications for cardiovascular conditions.
title: The Identification of Key Genes and Biological Pathways in Cardiac Arrest by Integrated Bioinformatics and Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: SNP rs5756795 was noted as significant in the genome-wide association studies for the hearing phenotype; it indicated strong associations with hearing difficulties (HDiff) and potentially played a role in age-related hearing impairment, being part of a larger set of 44 loci identified with gene sets enriched in auditory processes.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies 44 independent genomic loci for self-reported adult hearing difficulty in the UK Biobank cohort

finding: The PNPLA3 rs738409 C>G (I148M) mutation was linked to a significant increase in the prevalence of PGC-1α positive hepatocytes, suggesting a stimulation of mitochondrial biogenesis. This increase was reflected in enhanced levels of several markers for mitochondrial dynamics, including OPA1, DRP1, and PINK1, though it did not result in an overall increase in mitochondrial content. This finding underscores the role of this variant in altering hepatic mitochondrial activities despite not increasing overall mitochondrial mass.
title: Artificial intelligence as a ploy to delve into the intricate relationship between genetics and mitochondria in MASLD patients

finding: SNP rs2330635 adjacent to the MIF gene had an AdaptMix P-value of 7.06×10^-8. This SNP was associated with the expression of MIF in T-cells and is implicated in inflammatory responses, highlighting its involvement in immune regulation within the Peruvian cohort.
title: Disentangling signatures of selection before and after European colonization in Latin Americans

finding: The SNP rs1801311 was shown to confer SCZ risk by reducing neuronal differentiation capacity by 75% when comparing the risk allele (G) to the reference allele (A). This allele disrupted the binding motifs essential for enhancer activity.
title: Functional characterization of gene regulatory elements and neuropsychiatric disease-associated risk loci in iPSCs and iPSC-derived neurons

finding: The SNP rs4680 was significantly associated with schizophrenia (OR 1.245, p<0.001). It is a non-synonymous SNP that replaced valine with methionine at residue 158, leading to a 50%–75% reduction in COMT enzymatic activity, which has implications for dopamine metabolism.
title: Genetic risks of schizophrenia identified in a matched case-control study

finding: The SNP rs139298 resulted in the K121E mutation in APOBEC3H Haplotype I and was associated with lung cancer. This mutation destabilized A3H Hap I, leading to a loss of enzyme stability which was hypothesized to promote cancer evolution. Despite the common understanding that APOBEC3 enzymes cause mutations that drive malignancy, this finding suggested that the absence of stable A3H Hap I, rather than its presence, was implicated in lung cancer pathogenesis. This counterintuitive result indicated that overexpression of APOBEC3s, such as observable in tumors, could lead to an excessive mutation rate that may trigger immune responses or tumor cell death.
title: Induced mutagenesis by the DNA cytosine deaminase APOBEC3H Haplotype I protects against lung cancer

finding: The variant rs564796245 was linked with self-reported high cholesterol in the UK Biobank and was in the top 10% of variants by effect size within a 250kb window for related blood lipid traits. Specifically for HDL, it ranked in the top 1% of effect sizes, supporting its association with cholesterol.
title: Diverse transcriptomic signatures across human tissues identify functional rare genetic variation

finding: The rs9606250 SNP in DGCR8 was associated with the survival of breast cancer patients.
title: A pan-cancer atlas of somatic mutations in miRNA biogenesis genes

finding: The SNP rs134873 was found in a fetal brain-specific enhancer located at chr22:42657000-42658000, with a significant p-value of 2.4E-9. It was reliably associated with differential enhancer activity in MPRA assays and also identified as an expression quantitative trait loci (eQTL) for multiple genes including FAM109B, NAGA, LINC00634, and WBP2NL.
title: Regulome-wide association study identifies enhancer properties associated with risk for schizophrenia

finding: The SNP rs755622 was linked to similar findings as rs3063368, predicting acute kidney injury and death after cardiac surgery, highlighting its importance in clinical contexts.
title: Link between aging and atheroprotection in Mif-deficient atherosclerotic mice

finding: The study indicated that the rs5751901 polymorphism in the GGT1 gene was associated with an increased risk of acute pancreatitis, particularly among smokers, providing insights into genetic susceptibility in this context.
title: Identification of Key Genes and Underlying Mechanisms in Cystic Fibrosis and its Associated Complications Based on Bioinformatics Analysis of Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: Similar to rs383830, the SNP rs688034 associated with <SEZ6L> had been linked to CAD but did not achieve genome-wide significance subsequently. Nonetheless, it significantly influenced lipid parameters in cellular assays, resulting in its inclusion for the current analysis.
title: Pairwise genetic interactions modulate lipid plasma levels and cellular uptake

finding: The SNP rs972578 was associated with platelet count in humans. The expression of the gene NAGA, which correlated strongly negatively with parasitemia in red colobus monkeys, was potentially influenced by this SNP, highlighting its relevance in the context of malaria-like infections.
title: Immunogenetic response to a malaria-like parasite in a wild primate

finding: The SNP rs8137128 was linked to blood protein measurement in humans. The findings indicated that the expression of TBC1D9B correlated negatively with parasitemia, suggesting that this SNP might play a role in the immune response to malaria-like infections through its association with blood markers.
title: Immunogenetic response to a malaria-like parasite in a wild primate

finding: The 'C' allele of the top eSNP (rs5751775) for DDT (D-dopachrome tautomerase), which is functionally related to inflammatory cytokine MIF (migration inhibitory factor), increased DDT transcription in resting T cells but led to decreased expression after PHA stimulation. This SNP demonstrated a condition-dependent eQTL effect.
title: Neonatal genetics of gene expression reveal the origins of autoimmune and allergic disease risk

finding: The Val158Met (rs4680) polymorphism in the catechol-O-methyltransferase gene was related to pain perception in multiple sclerosis, suggesting its role in pain mechanisms.
title: Identification of key genes and signaling pathway in the pathogenesis of Huntington’s disease via bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs139883 in the SOX10 gene was associated with the age of onset in schizophrenia, indicating its potential involvement in neurodevelopmental disorders.
title: Identification of key genes and signaling pathway in the pathogenesis of Huntington’s disease via bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: Variant rs369691 was associated with the gene GSTT2 and showed widespread sharing across all tissues in multi-context studies (CxC). However, following the FastGxC analysis, it was noted that two specific sp-eQTLs emerged in two distinct skin tissues, highlighting the importance of context in identifying tissue-specific gene regulation.
title: Fast and powerful statistical method for context-specific QTL mapping in multi-context genomic studies

finding: The SNP rs5997893 located in miR-3928 exhibited a significant epistatic effect when combined with rs4947332 (HLA-DRB1), with an odds ratio (OR) of 4.23, underscoring interactions between miRNA genetic variation and HLA genes in RA.
title: MicroRNA variants and HLA-miRNA interactions are novel rheumatoid arthritis susceptibility factors

finding: The study highlighted that the translocator protein (18 kDa) polymorphism, specifically rs6971, was found to explain in-vivo brain binding affinity of the PET radioligand [(18)F]-FEPPA. This finding related to the functional impact of the SNP on neuroimaging measures and the potential implications for understanding brain dysfunction in neurological and psychiatric disorders.
title: Imaging transcriptomics: Convergent cellular, transcriptomic, and molecular neuroimaging signatures in the healthy adult human brain

finding: The rs6151429 variant was associated with the increased expression of the long isoform of the ARSA gene transcript, aligning with previous studies that indicated its functional significance.
title: The genetic determinants of the relative expression of alternative 3’UTR isoforms in human

finding: The COMT Val158Met polymorphism (rs4680), which involves a transition from guanine (G) to adenosine (A) at codon 158 of the COMT gene, showed significant associations with coping styles in long-tailed macaques. Specifically, the presence of the Val variant was linked to 'emotion-focused' and 'problem-focused' coping strategies. These strategies aligned with the observed emotional arousal as measured by infrared thermography, thereby connecting genetic variation to behavioral responses to stress in these primates.
title: Behavioural, physiological, and genetic drivers of coping

finding: The SNP rs62223875, present in the ESS2 gene, was significantly associated with suicide death and was characterized by a CADD PHRED score above 22, marking it as a rare, high-impact variant.
title: Rare protein coding variants implicate genes involved in risk of suicide death

finding: The Val/Val polymorphism of the COMT val158met allele (rs4680) was associated with an increased frequency of problem gambling. This polymorphism codes for a more active form of the COMT enzyme, which is presumed to lead to lower frontal dopamine levels. This association indicated that reduced frontal dopamine might heighten the likelihood of engaging in problem gambling behavior. Related research demonstrated that the effects of the COMT inhibitor tolcapone on compulsivity in pathological gamblers correlated with increases in fronto-parietal activity.
title: Dopamine and risky decision-making in pathological and problem gamblers

finding: The SNP rs16986825 showed nominal significance indicative of pancreatic cancer susceptibility as per analyses done in the context of GWAS.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel GP2 gene risk variants for pancreatic cancer in the Japanese population

finding: The SNP chr22:28695868:AG:A, a frameshift variant in the CHEK2 gene, was identified as being significantly associated with breast cancer. In the analysis involving 12,636 cases and 200,417 controls, this variant demonstrated an odds ratio (OR) of 2.04 and a p-value of 6.98×10^−22, with a minor allele count of 2,111. This finding marked a novel association of a genetic variant with breast cancer risks in a population of generally healthy adults not specifically ascertained for cancer.
title: Sequencing of 53,831 diverse genomes from the NHLBI TOPMed Program
